comment.author: 41909278@N08
comment._content:
As can be seen in the photograph, NAA dubbed this aircraft, built for Siam, the NA-50A. This was the result of its being the second single seat fighter design, the first being the 7 NA-50s for Peru. For customer identification, the aircraft was given the designation NA-68. When delivery proved impossible, the aircraft were commandeered by the USAAF and became pilot trainers, as P-64s.

Doug MacPhail
